definition: a design or representation made by various means (such as painting, drawing, or photography)

a description so vivid or graphic as to suggest a mental image or give an accurate idea of something                                      
             
             the book gives a detailed picture of what is happening
a mental image

image, copy                                      
             
             he was the picture of his father
a transitory visible image or reproduction
motion picture
movies
tableau sense 2

situation                                      
             
             took a hard look at his financial picture
to paint or draw a representation, image, or visual conception of : depict
to describe graphically in words
to form a mental image of : imagine
a painting, drawing, or photograph of someone or something
an idea of how something or someone looks, of what something is like, etc.
a general situation
to have a thought, understanding, or idea about (something or someone)
to show or represent (someone or something) in a painting, drawing, or photograph
to describe (something or someone) in a particular way
an image of something or someone formed on a surface (as by drawing, painting, printing, or photography)

an idea of what someone or something might look like or be like                                      
             
             The book gives a picture of frontier life.

a perfect example of something                                      
             
             She is the picture of health.
movie sense 1
an image on the screen of a television set

to show or represent in a drawing, painting, or photograph                                      
             
             The artist pictured her leaning on a fence.

to form an idea or mental image of : imagine                                      
             
             I can't picture myself skiing.

to describe in a particular way                                      
                

            The story pictured him as a gentle person.
in: the book gives a detailed picture of what is happening
he was the picture of his father
she was the very picture of health
took a hard look at his financial picture
I hung the picture on the wall.
The book has a lot of pictures.
Draw a picture of your house.
The staff looked at the financial picture of the company.
The overall economic picture is improving.
I can still picture the house I grew up in.
I can't picture changing jobs at this point in my life.
Picture what it would be like if you didn't own a car.
Can you picture him as a teacher?
The book gives a picture of frontier life.
She is the picture of health.
The artist pictured her leaning on a fence.
I can't picture myself skiing.

definition: a drawing, painting, or photograph
an image on a television, video, or computer screen
an image in your mind
a description or idea of what someone or something is like
Adjectives
Verbs
a film
the cinema
a situation
used for saying that you can communicate more with an image than with a long explanation
in: I noticed a picture on the dining-room wall.
a children’s book with bright colourful pictures
picture of: She showed me a picture of the house where she was born.
a picture of a peaceful country scene
draw/paint a picture: She asked children to draw pictures of their family.
take a picture  (=to use a camera to produce a photograph): I’ll stand over here, and you can take the picture.
Some viewers are suffering from poor picture quality on all channels.
I have such happy pictures in my mind of those times.
a mental picture: She had a mental picture of Samuel’s face.
picture of: My friends had a rather distorted picture of my life.
paint a picture (of something)  (=give a description): The report paints a rather gloomy picture of life in the inner cities.
It won the award for Best Picture.
The picture has changed a lot in the last couple of weeks.
The general picture was one of neglect and decline.
be/look a picture
the big/wider picture
get the picture
out of the picture
put someone in the picture
a/the picture of something

definition: a drawing, painting, photograph, etc.:
an image seen on a television or cinema screen:
a film:
the cinema:
something you produce in your mind, by using your imagination or memory:
(an idea of) a situation:
a situation described in a particular way:
to imagine something:
a representation of someone or something produced by drawing, painting, or photographing:
A picture is also an image seen on a television or movie screen:
A picture is also a movie:
a description of a situation, or the situation itself:
To paint a picture is to describe a situation:
to imagine how something looks:
an idea about what is happening in a particular situation:
the whole situation, as opposed to particular parts of it:
to make sure someone knows all the facts about a situation that is changing:
not part of or involved in a particular situation:
in: Freddy drew/painted a picture of my dog.
